Predicate-of.description: The predicate 'of' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject has some inherent or characteristic connection to the object. This can include possession, membership, origin, or other types of association.

Predicate-can_improve.label: can improve
Predicate-can_improve.description: The predicate 'can improve' indicates a potential relationship between two entities where one entity (subject) has the capacity to enhance or augment another entity (object). This implies that the subject possesses some quality, characteristic, or attribute that can positively impact the object's state, performance, or outcome.

Predicate-chooses.label: chooses
Predicate-chooses.description: Indicates a deliberate selection or preference between options, with the subject being the entity making the choice and the object representing one of the available alternatives.

Predicate-have_no_influence_on.label: have no influence on
Predicate-have_no_influence_on.description: The predicate 'have no influence on' indicates a lack of causal relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that any changes or effects observed in the object are not caused by, or dependent upon, the subject.

Predicate-is_a_technique_for_reducing_ea.label: is a technique for reducing each
Predicate-is_a_technique_for_reducing_ea.description: This predicate indicates that the subject is a method or approach used to simplify or condense the object into smaller units. The relationship between the subject and object suggests a process of abstraction, summarization, or compression.

Predicate-to.label: to
Predicate-to.description: The predicate 'to' indicates a relationship of transformation or conversion between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject is being changed or directed towards its root format, resulting in a new form or state.

Predicate-implement.label: implement
Predicate-implement.description: To implement means to put a plan or idea into action by integrating it with existing systems, processes, or tools. It involves bringing something new into being and making it functional, often requiring adjustments, modifications, or customizations to achieve its intended purpose.

Predicate-includes_(1).label: includes
Predicate-includes_(1).description: The predicate 'includes' indicates that the subject refers to a set or collection of things and the object is one or more specific items that are part of this larger group. In other words, it suggests that the subject encompasses or contains the object.

Predicate-follows.label: follows
Predicate-follows.description: The predicate 'follows' indicates a relationship of causality or consequence between the subject and object. It suggests that the state or value described by the subject has led to, resulted from, or is associated with the concept denoted by the object.

Predicate-can_define.label: can define
Predicate-can_define.description: The predicate 'can define' indicates that the subject has the ability to establish a clear and precise meaning or concept for the object. This implies a level of understanding, comprehension, or expertise on behalf of the subject regarding the object's nature, characteristics, or significance.

Predicate-is_the_most_common_choice_for.label: is the most common choice for
Predicate-is_the_most_common_choice_for.description: This predicate indicates that the subject is a preferred or typical option among others in relation to achieving or accomplishing the object. It suggests a sense of dominance or prevalence, implying that the subject has a higher frequency or likelihood of being chosen for the purpose described by the object.

Predicate-denotes.label: denotes
Predicate-denotes.description: The predicate 'denotes' indicates that the subject represents or signifies the object. In general, it suggests an equivalence or correspondence between the two entities, where the subject serves as a label or description for the object.

Predicate-is_part_of.label: is part of
Predicate-is_part_of.description: The predicate 'is part of' indicates that the subject is an integral component or constituent element within the object. It suggests a relationship where the subject contributes to the overall structure, composition, or nature of the object.

Predicate-would_like_to_find_out.label: would like to find out
Predicate-would_like_to_find_out.description: Expresses a desire for knowledge or information about something. The subject has an interest in discovering more about the object, which represents the topic or concept they wish to learn about.

Predicate-are_convenient_to_present.label: are convenient to present
Predicate-are_convenient_to_present.description: The predicate 'are convenient to present' indicates that the subject (in this case, Decision Tree  DT and RF classifiers) has a quality or characteristic that makes it easy or suitable for presenting information. The object refers to the valuable information itself, suggesting that the presentation of such information is facilitated by the characteristics of the subject.

Predicate-compared_in_a_study.label: compared in a study
Predicate-compared_in_a_study.description: The predicate 'compared in a study' indicates that the subject (a feature extraction technique) was investigated and evaluated within the context of a specific research study. The object, which represents this study, provides the framework for understanding how the subject was analyzed or examined.

Predicate-used_as_training_data.label: used as training data
Predicate-used_as_training_data.description: Indicates that a dataset or collection of data serves as input for training a machine learning model. This predicate connects the subject (the dataset) to the object (model training), implying that the former is utilized in some way to develop, refine, or test the latter.

Predicate-conduct.label: conduct
Predicate-conduct.description: To conduct means to take charge of and oversee a process or activity, often involving planning, execution, and management. The subject performs the action of conducting on the object, which can be an experiment, meeting, project, test, interview, etc., bringing it into being or guiding its progression.

Predicate-analyse.label: analyse
Predicate-analyse.description: To examine or investigate a subject (object) in order to identify patterns, relationships, or underlying structures. The predicate 'analyse' implies a systematic and often detailed examination of the object with the goal of gaining insight, understanding, or making informed decisions.

Predicate-have_a_relation_to.label: have a relation to
Predicate-have_a_relation_to.description: The predicate 'have a relation to' indicates that there exists some connection or association between the subject and object. This relationship can be based on various factors, such as similarity, contrast, categorization, classification, or any other meaningful link.

Predicate-is_trained_based_on.label: is trained based on
Predicate-is_trained_based_on.description: The predicate 'is trained based on' indicates that the subject (a proposed model or a machine learning algorithm) has been developed using the object as its foundation, guidance, or inspiration. In other words, it suggests that the subject's training data, methodology, or overall approach is rooted in or informed by the characteristics of the object.

Predicate-falls_within_the_range_of.label: falls within the range of
Predicate-falls_within_the_range_of.description: The predicate 'falls within the range of' indicates a relationship where the subject (a set or category) has its scope, extent, or magnitude bounded by the object (typically an interval, threshold, or benchmark). In other words, it suggests that the subject's characteristics, properties, or values are contained or situated within the specified limits defined by the object.

Predicate-by_testing.label: by testing
Predicate-by_testing.description: The predicate 'by testing' indicates a method or approach used to determine or evaluate something (the subject), resulting in a specific outcome or set of outcomes (the object).

Predicate-are_selected_in_each_experimen.label: are selected in each experiment
Predicate-are_selected_in_each_experimen.description: The predicate 'are selected in each experiment' indicates a relationship where the subject (in this case, 400 research proposals) is matched or paired with individual experiments. The selection process implies that the research proposals are being evaluated and chosen for participation in specific experimental settings.

Predicate-is_conducted_based_on.label: is conducted based on
Predicate-is_conducted_based_on.description: The predicate 'is conducted based on' indicates that the subject (an activity or process) relies on or uses a specific basis, framework, principle, or guideline to guide its execution. In general, this predicate suggests a causal relationship between the subject and object, implying that the object provides the foundation, justification, or criteria for conducting the subject.

Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' connects the subject to a description or explanation of an object. It indicates that the subject provides information about the nature, characteristics, or essence of the object.

Predicate-applied_to_implement.label: applied to implement
Predicate-applied_to_implement.description: The predicate 'applied to implement' indicates that a subject (e.g., a tool, framework, or methodology) was used as a means of creating or developing an object (e.g., a system, model, or algorithm). This connection implies that the subject played a crucial role in bringing the object into existence or enhancing its functionality.

Predicate-selecting.label: selecting
Predicate-selecting.description: The predicate 'selecting' indicates a process of choosing or picking out specific instances from a larger set based on certain criteria. It implies that the subject (in this case, experiments) has identified and prioritized particular objects (research proposals with high, low, and moderate IC-score) as relevant or suitable for further consideration.

Predicate-is_used_to_implement.label: is used to implement
Predicate-is_used_to_implement.description: This predicate indicates that a subject (a tool, framework, or system) employs or utilizes an object (an algorithm, technique, or methodology) to achieve its intended purpose. The relationship suggests that the subject relies on or incorporates the object as part of its functionality.

Predicate-is_a_significant_step_in_apply.label: is a significant step in applying
Predicate-is_a_significant_step_in_apply.description: This predicate indicates that the subject represents an important or crucial action taken to achieve the object. It implies that the subject plays a vital role in successfully implementing or utilizing the object, and its absence would significantly impact the overall process.

Predicate-define.label: define
Predicate-define.description: To establish or clarify the meaning of something by specifying its essential characteristics, boundaries, and relationships. The predicate 'define' connects a subject (typically an entity or concept) to an object (a term, concept, or phenomenon), indicating that the subject is being characterized or described in terms of the object's essence.

Predicate-need_to_implement.label: need to implement
Predicate-need_to_implement.description: To indicate a requirement or obligation for the subject to take action and put into practice or utilize something (the object), typically in order to achieve a specific goal or solve a problem.

Predicate-run_with_parameters.label: run with parameters
Predicate-run_with_parameters.description: The predicate 'run with parameters' indicates that the subject (in this case, a method) executes or performs an action while taking into account specific parameter values. The object represents these parameter values, which influence the behavior of the subject's execution.

Predicate-defined_for.label: defined for
Predicate-defined_for.description: The predicate 'defined for' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject specifies or determines the scope or range within which the object applies, operates, or has meaning.

Predicate-make.label: make
Predicate-make.description: The predicate 'make' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject has an influence on or brings about the state described by the object, often implying a transformation or creation of something.

Predicate-values_for.label: values for
Predicate-values_for.description: The predicate 'values for' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g., parameter) provides or assigns specific values to achieve or measure something specified by the object (e.g., each accuracy). This connection implies that the subject's values are relevant, applicable, or meaningful in relation to achieving or evaluating the object.

Predicate-set_as_follows.label: set as follows
Predicate-set_as_follows.description: The predicate 'set as follows' indicates a specific configuration or instruction for setting parameters or values. It connects the subject (the action or process) to the object (the parameter(s) being set), implying that the following settings are necessary or recommended in order to achieve the desired outcome.

Predicate-indicates.label: indicates
Predicate-indicates.description: The predicate 'indicates' establishes a relationship between its subject and object by showing or pointing out that the object represents or conveys information about the subject. In general, it suggests that the object serves as an indicator, signpost, or marker for the subject's meaning, significance, or value.

Predicate-adopt.label: adopt
Predicate-adopt.description: To adopt means to take on or assume a particular approach, method, or standard as one's own. It implies a deliberate and intentional decision to use or follow something, often in order to achieve a specific goal or outcome.

Predicate-applied_in.label: applied in
Predicate-applied_in.description: The predicate 'applied in' indicates a relationship where the subject (a technique or methodology) was used to achieve or accomplish something specified by the object. In general, it suggests that the subject played a crucial role in the process of obtaining or discovering the information described by the object.

Predicate-use.label: use
Predicate-use.description: To employ or apply something (e.g. a method, technique, tool, etc.) for a specific purpose or goal.

Predicate-has.label: has
Predicate-has.description: The predicate 'has' indicates a possession or attribution relationship between the subject and object, suggesting that the subject possesses, contains, or is characterized by the properties or attributes described by the object.

Predicate-defined_for_the_number_of_step.label: defined for the number of steps to run the optimization function
Predicate-defined_for_the_number_of_step.description: This predicate indicates that a specific entity (the subject) has its parameters or behavior determined by a certain number of iterations or steps used in an optimization process. The object represents the quantity of these steps, which serves as a boundary for the entity's defined scope.

Predicate-used_with.label: used with
Predicate-used_with.description: The predicate 'used with' indicates a relationship between two entities where one entity (the subject) employs or utilizes another entity (the object) to achieve a specific purpose, accomplish a task, or solve a problem. This connection implies that the subject relies on the object's capabilities, properties, or functions to operate effectively.

Predicate-can_consistently_achieve_bette.label: can consistently achieve better performance than
Predicate-can_consistently_achieve_bette.description: This predicate indicates a comparative relationship between two entities or systems (subject and object), suggesting that the subject has a consistent advantage over the object in terms of performance. The phrase 'can consistently achieve better' emphasizes the subject's ability to maintain high levels of performance, while 'better than' implies a relative superiority compared to the object.

Predicate-as_proposed_model.label: as proposed model
Predicate-as_proposed_model.description: Indicates that a proposal or suggestion has been made for how to approach or analyze something, with the subject indicating what was proposed and the object specifying the details of the proposal.

Predicate-shows_that_only.label: shows that only
Predicate-shows_that_only.description: The predicate 'shows that only' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject provides evidence or demonstrates that there exists exactly one instance of the attribute or characteristic described by the object. In other words, it highlights the uniqueness or singularity of the feature, property, or aspect represented by the object.

Predicate-prove.label: prove
Predicate-prove.description: To demonstrate or establish the validity or truthfulness of something through evidence, reasoning, or experimentation.

Predicate-can_be_understood_as.label: can be understood as
Predicate-can_be_understood_as.description: The predicate 'can be understood as' indicates a relationship between two concepts, where the subject (a concept or technique) can be interpreted or viewed as equivalent to the object (another concept or description). This connection suggests that there exists an analogy or correspondence between the two entities, allowing for a deeper comprehension of one by relating it to another.

Predicate-does_not_affect.label: does not affect
Predicate-does_not_affect.description: The predicate 'does not affect' indicates a lack of causal relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that any changes or influences made by the subject do not have an impact on, or alter in some way, the state or properties described by the object.

Predicate-does_not_use.label: does not use
Predicate-does_not_use.description: Indicates a lack of utilization or employment by the subject with respect to the object, implying that the subject does not rely on, utilize, or incorporate the object in its functioning or process.

Predicate-than_that_of.label: than that of
Predicate-than_that_of.description: The predicate 'than that of' indicates a comparison between two entities or concepts, with the subject being one entity and the object representing another. The phrase suggests that the relationship between the subject and the object is one of similarity or equivalence in terms of some characteristic or attribute.

Predicate-has_better_classification_accu.label: has better classification accuracy than
Predicate-has_better_classification_accu.description: This predicate indicates a comparison between two machine learning models or algorithms based on their performance metrics. It implies that the subject model has achieved better classification accuracy than the object model, suggesting superiority in terms of predictive power and reliability.

Predicate-are_still_crucial_because.label: are still crucial because
Predicate-are_still_crucial_because.description: The predicate 'are still crucial because' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the existence or relevance of the subject (the experimental results) has a direct impact on the importance or significance of the object (plot of DT classifier). In other words, the fact that the experimental results are still crucial implies that they have a decisive influence on the plot of the decision tree classifier.

Predicate-are_incorrectly_predicted_as.label: are incorrectly predicted as
Predicate-are_incorrectly_predicted_as.description: The predicate 'are incorrectly predicted as' indicates a mismatch or discrepancy between the subject and object. It suggests that the characteristics, properties, or attributes of the subject are not accurately reflected by its classification or categorization into the object category.

Predicate-are_guessed_wrongly_as.label: are guessed wrongly as
Predicate-are_guessed_wrongly_as.description: The predicate 'are guessed wrongly as' indicates a mismatch or incorrect association between the subject (6 research proposals) and object (high IC-score research proposals). It suggests that there is an error or misperception in how the subject is perceived, categorized, or classified by others.

Predicate-correctly_predicts.label: correctly predicts
Predicate-correctly_predicts.description: To accurately forecast or anticipate a specific outcome or result.

Predicate-incorrectly_predicts_as.label: incorrectly predicts as
Predicate-incorrectly_predicts_as.description: The predicate 'incorrectly predicts as' indicates that the subject (in this case, a model or system) produces an output that incorrectly categorizes or assigns to the object (e.g., research proposals), often in terms of some characteristic or property. This connection suggests that there is a mismatch between what was expected and what actually occurred.

Predicate-provide_insight_into.label: provide insight into
Predicate-provide_insight_into.description: To 'provide insight into' means to offer a deeper understanding or explanation of something by revealing its underlying nature, mechanisms, or workings. This predicate connects the subject (the entity providing the insight) with the object (what is being explained), implying that the subject has the ability to shed light on complex or obscure aspects of the object.

Predicate-may_not_predict.label: may not predict
Predicate-may_not_predict.description: The predicate 'may not predict' indicates that there is a lack of ability or capacity for the subject to accurately forecast or anticipate the object. It suggests that the relationship between the subject and the object is uncertain, unpredictable, or unreliable.

Predicate-correlate_with.label: correlate with
Predicate-correlate_with.description: To correlate with means to establish a relationship or connection between two entities (subject and object), typically indicating that changes or patterns observed in one entity are mirrored or reflected in another. This predicate suggests an association, correspondence, or parallelism between the subject and object.

Predicate-use_more_diverse_language.label: use more diverse language
Predicate-use_more_diverse_language.description: To 'use more diverse language' means to employ a range of linguistic expressions and styles that are inclusive, nuanced, and effective in conveying meaning. This predicate connects the subject (e.g., research proposal) with the object (e.g., low IC-score research proposals) by suggesting that using diverse language can improve the quality or impact of the subject's content.

Predicate-can_reach.label: can reach
Predicate-can_reach.description: Indicates that a subject has the capability or potential to attain or achieve something described by the object.

Predicate-can_achieve.label: can achieve
Predicate-can_achieve.description: Indicates that a subject has the potential or ability to attain or accomplish something described by the object.

Predicate-can_reach_an_accuracy_of_82.5.label: can reach an accuracy of 82.5%
Predicate-can_reach_an_accuracy_of_82.5.description: Indicates that a subject has the capability to achieve or attain a specific level of accuracy, in this case 82.5%, when performing an action or using a method described by the object.

Predicate-shows_the_rare_terms_associate.label: shows the rare terms associated with
Predicate-shows_the_rare_terms_associate.description: This predicate indicates a relationship between a subject and an object where the subject reveals or highlights specific, uncommon terms that are connected to or characteristic of the object. The rare terms may be indicative of unique features, patterns, or themes associated with the object.

Predicate-achieves_an_accuracy_of_84.17.label: achieves an accuracy of 84.17%
Predicate-achieves_an_accuracy_of_84.17.description: The predicate 'achieves an accuracy of 84.17%' indicates the level of precision or correctness that a subject (typically, a model, algorithm, or system) has attained in relation to its performance on a specific task or problem domain.

Predicate-can_be_carried_out_from.label: can be carried out from
Predicate-can_be_carried_out_from.description: This predicate indicates that an action or process (subject) can be initiated, started, or performed using a particular perspective, approach, method, or means (object). The object provides the foundation, framework, or starting point for carrying out the subject. In general, this predicate highlights the relationship between the way something is done and the context in which it is done.

Predicate-should_not_be.label: should not be
Predicate-should_not_be.description: The predicate 'should not be' indicates a negative relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject (e.g., innovation) should not have or possess the quality, characteristic, or attribute described by the object (e.g., being the only evaluation criterion). In general, this predicate implies a rejection of an absolute or exclusive claim made about the subject.

Predicate-can_apply.label: can apply
Predicate-can_apply.description: The predicate 'can apply' indicates that a subject (in this case, a project) has the capability or potential to utilize one or more specific methods or techniques (represented by the object), which are suitable for achieving its goals or solving its problems.

Predicate-can_also_apply_some_other_effe.label: can also apply some other effective data mining models, such as
Predicate-can_also_apply_some_other_effe.description: This predicate indicates that a subject (typically an entity or process) has the ability to utilize multiple data mining models beyond what's explicitly mentioned. The phrase 'some other effective' suggests flexibility and adaptability, implying that the subject can leverage various approaches depending on the context.

Predicate-perform_well_in.label: perform well in
Predicate-perform_well_in.description: To indicate that a subject has achieved a satisfactory level of proficiency or achievement within a specific domain, context, or activity denoted by the object. The predicate 'perform well in' suggests a positive evaluation of the subject's performance relative to expectations or standards.

Predicate-can_also_be_our_next_research_.label: can also be our next research focus on
Predicate-can_also_be_our_next_research_.description: This predicate indicates that the subject has a potential or possible connection to the object as a future area of investigation. It suggests that the subject's capabilities, characteristics, or applications can be explored further in relation to the object.

Predicate-contains_only_key_terms_for.label: contains only key terms for
Predicate-contains_only_key_terms_for.description: The predicate 'contains only key terms for' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject has a specific subset of relevant information or characteristics that are applicable to, or describe, the object. This connection suggests that the subject's contents have been filtered or condensed to provide essential details about the object.

Predicate-builds.label: builds
Predicate-builds.description: The predicate 'builds' indicates a process of creation or development where the subject contributes to the formation or establishment of the object. It implies a sense of intentional design, planning, and execution that results in the emergence of something new or improved.

Predicate-The_data_set_used_to_analyse_t.label: The data set used to analyse the grant applications described in this paper
Predicate-The_data_set_used_to_analyse_t.description: This predicate describes a relationship between a written work (the subject) and a data set used for analysis, specifying the object as the actual dataset employed in analyzing grant applications described within that written work.

Predicate-introduces.label: introduces
Predicate-introduces.description: The predicate 'introduces' indicates a relationship where the subject provides initial or preliminary information about the object. This can include presenting, explaining, or describing the key aspects of the object in a concise manner.

Predicate-used_to_obtain.label: used to obtain
Predicate-used_to_obtain.description: The predicate 'used to obtain' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object, suggesting that the subject was employed or utilized in order to achieve or gain access to the object. In other words, the subject played a role in obtaining or acquiring the information, data, results, etc., represented by the object.

Predicate-used_for.label: used for
Predicate-used_for.description: The predicate 'used for' indicates a relationship between two entities where one entity (the subject) serves as a means or instrument to achieve a specific purpose or goal, which is described by the other entity (the object).

Predicate-This_paper_uses.label: This paper uses
Predicate-This_paper_uses.description: The predicate 'This paper uses' indicates a relationship between the subject (a written work, typically academic or scholarly in nature) and its methodological or analytical resources. The object of this predicate refers to the specific tools, techniques, data sets, or other materials employed by the author(s) in their research, analysis, or argumentation.

Predicate-can_be_used_to_better_predict.label: can be used to better predict
Predicate-can_be_used_to_better_predict.description: The predicate 'can be used to better predict' indicates a relationship between the subject (a data set, model, or other entity) and an object (typically another entity or process), where the subject has the potential to improve the accuracy of predictions made by the object. This connection suggests that the subject provides valuable information or insights that can inform decision-making or modeling processes.

Predicate-proposes.label: proposes
Predicate-proposes.description: The predicate 'proposes' indicates a relationship where the subject presents or suggests an idea, plan, or solution to be considered or implemented. The object typically represents the entity being proposed, which can be a concept, method, project, or other type of proposal.

Predicate-relates.label: relates
Predicate-relates.description: The predicate 'relates' indicates a connection or association between two entities (subject and object), suggesting that there is some logical link, similarity, or correspondence between them. This relationship can be one of equivalence, analogy, causality, or any other type of meaningful correlation.

Predicate-was_applied.label: was applied
Predicate-was_applied.description: The predicate 'was applied' indicates that a specific technique or method (object) has been used to achieve a particular outcome or solve a problem, with the subject being the entity that underwent this treatment. This connection implies a causal relationship between the subject and object, suggesting that the application of the method had an impact on the subject.

Predicate-can_better_predict.label: can better predict
Predicate-can_better_predict.description: The predicate 'can better predict' indicates that the subject has a superior ability to forecast or anticipate outcomes, trends, or patterns in relation to the object. It suggests that the subject's predictive capabilities are more accurate, reliable, or effective than others for understanding or analyzing the object.

Predicate-used_to_analyze.label: used to analyze
Predicate-used_to_analyze.description: The predicate 'used to analyze' indicates a relationship between an entity (the subject) and its purpose or function in analyzing something (the object). It suggests that the subject was designed, intended, or employed for the specific task of analysis.

Predicate-assist.label: assist
Predicate-assist.description: To facilitate or support a process, activity, or decision-making by providing resources, guidance, or expertise that enables the subject to achieve its intended goal or outcome.

Predicate-applies.label: applies
Predicate-applies.description: The predicate 'applies' indicates a relationship where the subject (a process or method) is used to relate or connect with the object (typically an outcome, result, or standard), suggesting that the subject's purpose or function is to bring about or conform to the state described by the object.

Predicate-The_experimental_results_are_b.label: The experimental results are based on
Predicate-The_experimental_results_are_b.description: This predicate indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject provides the foundation or underlying information for the object, which in this case are the experimental results. The phrase 'based on' implies a logical connection where the subject serves as evidence, support, or justification for the object.

Predicate-refers_to.label: refers_to
Predicate-refers_to.description: The predicate 'refers_to' indicates a relationship of self-reference or citation between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject (typically an entity, such as a document) points to itself or another entity for explanation, illustration, or clarification.

Predicate-were_used_to_obtain.label: were used to obtain
Predicate-were_used_to_obtain.description: This predicate indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object, suggesting that the subject was employed or utilized as a means of achieving or acquiring the object. The subject's purpose or function is to facilitate the obtaining of the object.

Predicate-assist_in.label: assist in
Predicate-assist_in.description: The predicate 'assist in' indicates a supportive role between two entities or processes. It suggests that the subject (our proposed pipeline and the data mining model, for example) provides help, guidance, or facilitation to achieve a specific goal or outcome described by the object (data mining models to assist in the manual review of research proposals). In general, 'assist in' implies a collaborative relationship where one entity enables or enhances another's ability to accomplish something.

Predicate-aid_human_evaluators.label: aid human evaluators
Predicate-aid_human_evaluators.description: To support or facilitate the decision-making process of human evaluators by providing relevant information, insights, or tools that enhance their ability to assess and evaluate data mining models.

Predicate-utilize.label: utilize
Predicate-utilize.description: To make use of or take advantage of something (the object) for a specific purpose or goal (implied by the subject).

Predicate-assist_in_the_manual_review.label: assist in the manual review
Predicate-assist_in_the_manual_review.description: To facilitate or support a human reviewer's evaluation process by providing guidance, insights, or tools that help them make informed decisions about research proposals, data sets, or other materials.

Predicate-assist_in_achieving_an_accurac.label: assist in achieving an accuracy
Predicate-assist_in_achieving_an_accurac.description: The predicate 'assist in achieving an accuracy' indicates that the subject (e.g., data mining models) plays a role in improving or enhancing the accuracy of the object (e.g., manual review process, research proposals). It suggests that the subject's involvement contributes to reaching a higher level of precision or correctness.

Predicate-assist_in_evaluating.label: assist in evaluating
Predicate-assist_in_evaluating.description: To facilitate or enable the process of evaluation by providing support, guidance, or tools that help to assess or judge something's quality, relevance, or validity.

Predicate-introduce.label: introduce
Predicate-introduce.description: To present or make known something to others for the first time, often in a formal or official manner. This predicate indicates that the subject has brought forth information about itself or its nature to the object's attention.

Predicate-can_be_used_to.label: can be used to
Predicate-can_be_used_to.description: The predicate 'can be used to' indicates a functional relationship between the subject and object, suggesting that the subject serves as a means or tool to achieve some purpose or outcome described by the object. In general, this predicate implies a causal connection where the subject's existence, properties, or characteristics enable or facilitate the realization of the object.

Predicate-is_required.label: is required
Predicate-is_required.description: The predicate 'is required' indicates that some action or condition must be fulfilled before something else can happen. It implies a necessary step or prerequisite, which serves as the foundation for subsequent events or processes.

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates a relationship where the subject provides or offers something to someone else, often in an official or formal capacity. The object represents what is being provided or offered, which can be information, results, findings, or other types of knowledge.

Predicate-are_related.label: are related
Predicate-are_related.description: The predicate 'are related' indicates a connection or association between two entities (subject and object), suggesting that they share common characteristics, concepts, themes, or ideas. This relationship can be one of similarity, relevance, analogy, or causality, implying that the subject and object are intertwined in some way.

Predicate-is_related_to.label: is related to
Predicate-is_related_to.description: The predicate 'is related to' indicates a connection or association between two concepts. It suggests that there exists some logical link, similarity, or relevance between the subject and object, which can be based on various factors such as context, purpose, methodology, outcome, or other relationships.

Predicate-reach_an_accuracy.label: reach an accuracy
Predicate-reach_an_accuracy.description: To indicate that a subject has achieved or attained a certain level of precision or correctness in relation to a specific task or evaluation criteria represented by the object.

Predicate-relates_(1).label: relates
Predicate-relates_(1).description: Indicates a connection or correspondence between two entities, concepts, or ideas, suggesting that they share common characteristics, properties, or relationships.

Predicate-can_reach_an_accuracy.label: can reach an accuracy
Predicate-can_reach_an_accuracy.description: The predicate 'can reach an accuracy' indicates that the subject has the capability to achieve a certain level of precision or correctness in its performance, measurement, or prediction. It implies a potential for achieving a specific standard or benchmark, which is described by the object.

Predicate-consists_of.label: consists of
Predicate-consists_of.description: The predicate 'consists of' indicates that the subject is composed or made up of the object, suggesting a part-whole relationship where the subject's essence or identity is defined by its constituent parts.

Predicate-contains.label: contains
Predicate-contains.description: The predicate 'contains' indicates a relationship where the subject encompasses or has within it the object. This can imply spatial, temporal, or conceptual inclusion, suggesting that the subject possesses or holds the object as part of its entirety.

Predicate-are_classified_by.label: are classified by
Predicate-are_classified_by.description: The predicate 'are classified by' indicates a categorization or classification relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject (in this case, data mining models) are grouped or organized according to some criteria or system defined by the object (IC-score proposals).

Predicate-are_used_to.label: are used to
Predicate-are_used_to.description: The predicate 'are used to' indicates a purpose or function that something (the subject) serves. It implies that the thing described by the subject exists for, or has been designed to achieve, the outcome or goal specified in the object.

Predicate-analyze.label: analyze
Predicate-analyze.description: To examine or scrutinize a given object in order to identify patterns, relationships, or underlying structures. The predicate 'analyze' implies a systematic and often detailed investigation of the object's properties, characteristics, or behavior.

Predicate-used_as_input.label: used as input
Predicate-used_as_input.description: The predicate 'used as input' indicates a relationship where the subject (a source of information or proposal) provides its contents to be processed, analyzed, or utilized by the object (the entity that receives and utilizes this information). This connection implies a one-way flow of data from the subject to the object.

Predicate-is_required_based_on.label: is required based on
Predicate-is_required_based_on.description: Indicates that the subject requires or necessitates something in order to exist, be valid, or be performed. The predicate 'is required based on' establishes a causal relationship between the subject and object, implying that the object serves as the foundation, justification, or condition for the subject's requirement.

Predicate-require.label: require
Predicate-require.description: The predicate 'require' indicates that something (typically an action or process) must be done before another thing can happen, be accomplished, or exist. It implies a necessary condition for the subject to achieve its goal or state.

Predicate-is_required_for.label: is required for
Predicate-is_required_for.description: The predicate 'is required for' indicates a causal relationship between two entities or processes. It suggests that one entity (the subject) has a specific function, purpose, or condition necessary to achieve the other entity (the object). In general, it implies that the existence or occurrence of the subject is essential for the realization or fulfillment of the object.

Predicate-is_required_before.label: is required before
Predicate-is_required_before.description: The predicate 'is required before' indicates that one action or process (the subject) must be completed prior to another action or process (the object). It implies a temporal relationship of precedence, where the completion of the first action enables or prepares for the second. In general, it suggests a causal link between the two actions.

Predicate-applied_to_analyze.label: applied to analyze
Predicate-applied_to_analyze.description: The predicate 'applied to analyze' indicates that a subject (e.g., an experiment or method) has been utilized to examine and interpret the object (e.g., data set), resulting in insights, findings, or conclusions.

Predicate-is_used_as_input_for.label: is used as input for
Predicate-is_used_as_input_for.description: This predicate indicates that the subject provides or supplies information to be processed or utilized by the object. The relationship suggests a directional flow of data from the subject to the object, where the subject's output serves as input for the object's processing or analysis.

Predicate-used_as_input_for.label: used as input for
Predicate-used_as_input_for.description: The predicate 'used as input for' indicates a relationship where the subject provides or supplies information to be processed, analyzed, or utilized by the object. This connection implies that the subject serves as a source of data, insights, or knowledge that can inform or guide the actions taken by the object.

Predicate-includes_the_accuracy_and_effe.label: includes the accuracy and effectiveness of
Predicate-includes_the_accuracy_and_effe.description: This predicate indicates that the subject's quality or performance is evaluated based on its ability to accurately represent reality and achieve a desired outcome. The object provides the context in which this evaluation takes place, serving as the standard against which the subject's accuracy and effectiveness are measured.

Predicate-can_be_used_as_input_for.label: can be used as input for
Predicate-can_be_used_as_input_for.description: This predicate indicates that the subject has a specific role or function in relation to the object. The subject provides information or data that can be utilized as input for processing, analysis, or computation by the object. In general, this predicate establishes a connection between the subject and object where the subject serves as a source of input for the object's operations.

Predicate-analyzes.label: analyzes
Predicate-analyzes.description: To analyze something means to examine or investigate it in order to understand its structure, components, relationships, or underlying principles. The subject of the predicate 'analyzes' is actively engaged in a process of scrutiny and interpretation, seeking to uncover insights, patterns, or meanings that may not be immediately apparent from casual observation.

Predicate-encoded_with_features_denoting.label: encoded with features denoting the presence or absence
Predicate-encoded_with_features_denoting.description: This predicate indicates that the subject (e.g. an idea) has been associated with a set of characteristics or attributes that describe its presence or absence in relation to the object (e.g. experiments). The connection between the subject and object suggests a causal or explanatory relationship, where the features encoded on the subject help explain or predict the outcome or results described by the object.

Predicate-extract.label: extract
Predicate-extract.description: To extract means to take out or obtain a specific piece of information, content, or essence from something larger. This predicate connects the subject (typically an entity that contains the desired information) with the object (the extracted item), implying a process of identification and isolation.

Predicate-This_paper_proposes_a_data_min.label: This paper proposes a data mining model with a Random Forest classifier over documents encoded with features denoting the presence or absence of unigram terms, which can better predict research proposals close to the original training set settings.
Predicate-This_paper_proposes_a_data_min.description: This predicate describes a relationship where an entity (typically a research paper or publication) presents, suggests, or proposes the development of a data mining model that can accurately predict specific outcomes (in this case, research proposals). The connection between the subject and object lies in the idea that the proposed model is being presented as a solution to improve prediction accuracy.

Predicate-can_be_used_to_analyse.label: can be used to analyse
Predicate-can_be_used_to_analyse.description: To indicate that a particular entity or method can be employed to examine, interpret, or understand the meaning of something. This predicate establishes a connection between an analytical tool and its potential application in analyzing data, information, or concepts.

Predicate-The_proposed_model_can_better_.label: The proposed model can better predict research proposals close to the original training set settings as described in This paper
Predicate-The_proposed_model_can_better_.description: The predicate describes a relationship between a proposed model, research proposals, and the original training set settings. It indicates that the proposed model has improved predictive capabilities when applied to research proposals with characteristics similar to those in the original training set, as described in the given paper.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is related to or encompasses the object in some way. It suggests that the subject is a more specific instance of, or a refinement of, the concept represented by the object.
